oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Interaction of a characteristic shock with a weak discontinuity in a non-ideal gas
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: PANDEY, M
SHARMA, VD
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: dusty gas
wave
evolution
systems
flows
characteristic shock
van der waals gas
weak discontinuity
group theoretic method
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The Lie group of point transformations, which leave the equations for plane and radially symmetric flows of a non-ideal gas invariant, are used to obtain an exact solution that exhibits space-time dependence. We consider the propagation of a weak discontinuity through a state, characterized by this solution. Further, the evolution of a characteristic shock and its interaction with the weak discontinuity are studied. The properties of reflected and transmitted waves and the jump in shock acceleration, influenced by the incident wave amplitude and the van der Waals excluded volume, are completely characterized, and certain observations are noted in respect of their contrasting behaviour. (c) 2006 Elsevier B. V. .
